article.title: Sunday Talk
article.text:
CT ’21  WFSB  8:30 a.m.

Host: Eric Parker

Covid Vaccines for Kids

– Dr. Onyema Ogbuagu / Infectious Diseases Specialist at Yale Medicine

Car Break-Ins Legislation

– State Rep. Jason Perillo / (R) 113TH District (Shelton)

– Anthony Salvatore / Cromwell Town Manager

Sunday Spotlight:  Hole in the Wall Gang Camp

– Jimmy Canton / CEO of Hole in the Wall Gang Camp
– Carly Demartino / Camper who has attended Hole in the Wall Gang Camp

 

Power & Politics News12 Saturday at 4:30 pm & 6:30/ Sunday 11:30am & 6:30pm.

Host: John Craven

Black History Month special on Black political leaders across the Tri-State area 
 

This Week in Connecticut WTNH 10:00 am

Host: Dennis House

Subjects:  Covid and children, urban revitalization, gun violence, business expansion 
-Senator Chris Murphy
-Dr David Bendor Institute of Living
-Mayor Erin Stewart  New Britain 
 
Also: Reports from Jodi Latina, Mackenzie Maynard, Kent Pierce, Lisa Carberg 
 

CT Capitol Report WTNH  10:30am

Host: Tom Dudchik

Rep. Kate Farrar (D-West Hartford) joins the panel.

-Vaccines
-Capitol Roundup with Jodi Latina
-Who is leading the GOP?
 
 

 

The Real Story  Fox61  10 a.m.

Host: Jenn Bernstein

Connecticut Senators Richard Blumenthal and Chris Murphy talk about federal gun reform, potential summer school for students, and coronavirus relief bill talks.

Connecticut State Senators Heather Somers and Tony Hwang talk about the vaccine school exemption debate, vaccinating teachers, and vaccine rollout efforts in Connecticut.

 

Face the Facts WVIT 10 a.m.

Host: Mike Hydeck

Sen. Kevin Kelly/(R) Minority leader responding to the governor’s budget proposal

Chris DiPentima, President & CEO of CBIA

Christine Stuart on the debate at the capitol this week over repealing the religious exemption for childhood vaccines
